qas.question: Which law first referred to the prime minister in Canada?
When was the Constitution Act passed?
The Constitution Act mentions the prime minister in the context of which kinds of other ministers?
What country has completly uncodified constitution?
What document in Canada has allowed for a prime minister since it was drafted?
What act was passed in the 18th century?

context: <b3_0>Canada<b3_0/>'s <b4_0>constitution<b4_0/>, being a 'mixed' or hybrid constitution (a constitution that is partly formally codified and partly uncodified) originally did not make any reference whatsoever to a prime minister, with her or his specific duties and method of appointment instead dictated by "convention". In <a0_0><b5_0>the Constitution Act<b5_0/><a0_0/>, <a1_0>1982<a1_0/>, passing reference to a "Prime Minister of Canada" is added, though only regarding the composition of conferences of <a2_0>federal and provincial first ministers<a2_0/>.
